meanings.definition: To remove calcium deposits from something.
meanings.sent1: The dentist decalcified my teeth to keep them healthy.
meanings.sent2: She decalcified the showerhead to improve water flow.
meanings.sent3: After the cleaning, the decalcified faucet sparkled like new.
meanings.sent4: The decalcified kettle whistled happily on the stove.
meanings.sent5: The decalcified bones of the ancient dinosaur were carefully studied by scientists.

meanings.definition: To make something less hard by removing calcium.
meanings.sent1: The chef decalcified the water to make the pasta softer.
meanings.sent2: He decalcified the soil to help the plants grow better.
meanings.sent3: The decalcified eggshell cracked easily in the palm of her hand.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the decalcified pearls on her necklace.
meanings.sent5: The decalcified rock crumbled under the weight of the hiker's boot.
